intro: Trichanthecium schwackeanum, commonly known as the Schwacke's trichanthecium, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, yellow to orange flowers arranged in clusters. It typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
